results.title: Being True Blue
results.creator_credit: Kay Donovan, Australia. Office of Multicultural Affairs and SBS-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian mosaic”.
This documentary explores what it means to be an Australian citizen and just what a new citizen is welcome to. In interviews with historians, social planners and ordinary people, ‘Being True Blue’ looks behind the facade of the national anthem, the sports hero, the bushman and the other cheap barometers of identity.

results.title: Fabric of change
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian mosaic”.
This video discusses the effect of restructuring in the textiles, clothing and footwear industries. Removal of tarrif barriers by 1995 may lead to retrenchment of workers, many of whom are migrant women. The industries must modernise and become more productive if they are to survive. The resource notes accompanying the video are student centred (Years 10-12), particularly for those doing Economics, Commerce and Business Studies.

results.title: Lost wax memory
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian mosaic”.
Phillip Piperides, an Australian Cypriot is a sculptor in bronze. He explains the lost wax process of casting in bronze and explains the appeal of this particular form of sculpture. Shows examples of his work in Brisbane.

results.title: Win, lose or draw
results.creator_credit: Graeme MacLeod, Heather Williams, Australia. Special Broadcasting Service and Excalibur Nominees
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian mosaic”.
The staging of the Americas Cup in Fremantle had a huge impact on the redevelopment of Perth’s old seaport. Heritage buildings were restored, some lovingly, some superficially and new tourist and shopping precincts were created. This program explores the short and long-term effects of the development on the people of Fremantle, both rich and poor, businessmen and tenants and should give valuable lessons to others planning major redevelopment around a once-off major event such as the Americas Cup.

results.title: Old Songs in a New Land: A Piece of Jewish Australian ...
results.creator_credit: Judy Menczel, Barbara Mariotti and SBS-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian mosaic”.
Inspired by an exhibition of the same name held at Hyde Park Barracks, Sydney 1988 and organised by the Bicentennial Committee, NSW Jewish Board of Deputies, this video portrays the history of the Jews in Australia from those who arrived on the First Fleet to the Jewish immigrants from Russia of the present day. Interviews with representatives of the Jewish community highlight the differences which still exist within the community which yet retains a distinctively Jewish character.

results.title: Didgeridoo in Deutschland
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian mosaic”.
Take an Aboriginal musician and an Australian composer … put them in the middle of Europe and what have you got? If the composer is George Dreyfus, the musician is Richard Walley, poet and exponent of the didgeridoo, and the European country is Germany, you get a fascinating look at two individuals whose people have been persecuted but whose vastly different cultures can come together in a totally satisfying work. Made with the assistance of the Department of Aboriginal Affairs.

results.title: Threads of Ireland
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian mosaic”.
This program looks at the traditions and culture brought to Australia by the Irish Catholic convicts, and the way in which the Irish influence is still present in modern Australia. Explores the history of Australian writing, music and religion which have an Irish influence.

results.title: Buddha wish me luck
results.creator_credit: Sally Ingleton, Margaret Smith and SBS-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian mosaic”.
Erwin, a refugee from Hungary and his wife Samran, whom he met on a trip to Thailand live near Darwin. They describe their separate experiences as immigrants to Australia, their life together and the small tropical fruit farm that they own. Erwin is a loner, who likes nothing better than to go off hunting crocodiles, or fishing, but his wife Samran enjoys the human contact and busyness of the market where she sells her fruit. A tantalising glimpse into a marriage between two quite different people.

results.title: We grow here
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian mosaic”.
Interviews with Sicilian migrants who ended up making the lush lands of Northern Queensland their home. The men and women describe the hardship of their lives in Sicily, talk about their initial impressions on arrival in Australia and explore their sometimes ambivalent attachments to their two “homelands”.

results.title: You jump, you fly: a multicultural textile project linking health and art
results.creator_credit: Luigi Acquisto, Australia Council and Australia. Special Broadcasting Service
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian mosaic”.
At the Coburg Community Health Centre, Anne Marie Power, textile artist, talks about groups of women that were linked together through a textile project. The common theme revolved around their houses and lives, and the women were able to develop skills which had previously been undervalued. The aim was to increase the self-awareness and self-esteem of the participants thus resulting in better health. The women with well-developed skills taught the others so a sense of group was developed.
